content.text: jQuery Effects - Fading
With jQuery you can fade elements in and out of visibility.
content.html: With jQuery you can fade elements in and out of visibility.

content.text: Click to fade in/out panel
content.html: Click to fade in/out panel

content.text: Because time is valuable, we deliver quick and easy learning.
content.html: Because time is valuable, we deliver quick and easy learning.

content.text: At W3Schools, you can study everything you need to learn, in an accessible and handy format.
content.html: At W3Schools, you can study everything you need to learn, in an accessible and handy format.

content.text: Examples
jQuery fadeIn() Demonstrates the jQuery fadeIn() method.
content.html:
jQuery fadeIn()
Demonstrates the jQuery fadeIn() method.

content.html:

content.text: jQuery fadeTo() Demonstrates the jQuery fadeTo() method.
content.html:
jQuery fadeTo()
Demonstrates the jQuery fadeTo() method.

content.text: jQuery Fading Methods
With jQuery you can fade an element in and out of visibility.
content.html: With jQuery you can fade an element in and out of visibility.

content.text: jQuery has the following fade methods:
content.html: jQuery has the following fade methods:

content.text: jQuery fadeIn() Method
The jQuery fadeIn() method is used to fade in a hidden element.
content.html: The jQuery fadeIn() method is used to fade in a hidden element.

content.text: Syntax:
content.html: Syntax:

content.code_html: $(selector).fadeIn(speed,callback);

content.text: The optional speed parameter specifies the duration of the effect. It can take the following values: "slow", "fast", or milliseconds.
content.html: The optional speed parameter specifies the duration of the effect. It can take the following values: "slow", "fast", or milliseconds.

content.text: The optional callback parameter is a function to be executed after the fading completes.
content.html: The optional callback parameter is a function to be executed after the fading completes.

content.text: The following example demonstrates the fadeIn() method with different parameters:
content.html: The following example demonstrates the fadeIn() method with different parameters:

content.code_html:
$("button").click(function(){
  $("#div1").fadeIn();
  $("#div2").fadeIn("slow");
  $("#div3").fadeIn(3000);
});

content.text: jQuery fadeOut() Method
The jQuery fadeOut() method is used to fade out a visible element.
content.html: The jQuery fadeOut() method is used to fade out a visible element.

content.text: Syntax:
content.html: Syntax:

content.text: The optional speed parameter specifies the duration of the effect. It can take the following values: "slow", "fast", or milliseconds.
content.html: The optional speed parameter specifies the duration of the effect. It can take the following values: "slow", "fast", or milliseconds.

content.text: The optional callback parameter is a function to be executed after the fading completes.
content.html: The optional callback parameter is a function to be executed after the fading completes.

content.text: The following example demonstrates the fadeOut() method with different parameters:
content.html: The following example demonstrates the fadeOut() method with different parameters:

content.code_html:
$("button").click(function(){
  $("#div1").fadeOut();
  $("#div2").fadeOut("slow");
  $("#div3").fadeOut(3000);
});

content.text: jQuery fadeToggle() Method
The jQuery fadeToggle() method toggles between the fadeIn() and fadeOut() methods.
content.html: The jQuery fadeToggle() method toggles between the fadeIn() and fadeOut() methods.

content.text: If the elements are faded out, fadeToggle() will fade them in.
content.html: If the elements are faded out, fadeToggle() will fade them in.

content.text: If the elements are faded in, fadeToggle() will fade them out.
content.html: If the elements are faded in, fadeToggle() will fade them out.

content.text: Syntax:
content.html: Syntax:

content.text: The optional speed parameter specifies the duration of the effect. It can take the following values: "slow", "fast", or milliseconds.
content.html: The optional speed parameter specifies the duration of the effect. It can take the following values: "slow", "fast", or milliseconds.

content.text: The optional callback parameter is a function to be executed after the fading completes.
content.html: The optional callback parameter is a function to be executed after the fading completes.

content.text: The following example demonstrates the fadeToggle() method with different parameters:
content.html: The following example demonstrates the fadeToggle() method with different parameters:

content.code_html:
$("button").click(function(){
  $("#div1").fadeToggle();
  $("#div2").fadeToggle("slow");
  $("#div3").fadeToggle(3000);
});

content.text: jQuery fadeTo() Method
The jQuery fadeTo() method allows fading to a given opacity (value between 0 and 1).
content.html: The jQuery fadeTo() method allows fading to a given opacity (value between 0 and 1).

content.text: Syntax:
content.html: Syntax:

content.code_html: $(selector).fadeTo(speed,opacity,callback);

content.text: The required speed parameter specifies the duration of the effect. It can take the following values: "slow", "fast", or milliseconds.
content.html: The required speed parameter specifies the duration of the effect. It can take the following values: "slow", "fast", or milliseconds.

content.text: The required opacity parameter in the fadeTo() method specifies fading to a given opacity (value between 0 and 1).
content.html: The required opacity parameter in the fadeTo() method specifies fading to a given opacity (value between 0 and 1).

content.text: The optional callback parameter is a function to be executed after the function completes.
content.html: The optional callback parameter is a function to be executed after the function completes.

content.text: The following example demonstrates the fadeTo() method with different parameters:
content.html: The following example demonstrates the fadeTo() method with different parameters:

content.code_html:
$("button").click(function(){
  $("#div1").fadeTo("slow", 0.15);
  $("#div2").fadeTo("slow", 0.4);
  $("#div3").fadeTo("slow", 0.7);
});

Test Yourself With Exercises
Exercise:
Use a jQuery method to fade out a <div> element.
content.html: Use a jQuery method to fade out a <div> element.

content.html: Start the Exercise
